pull.title: BIP174: add hash preimage fields to inputs
pull.body:
These fields are needed to solve miniscripts, which may have hash preimage challenges.

See https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2019-March/016720.html for some earlier (very short) discussion.

issue.title: Psbt: Add finalizer and extractor
issue.body:
Implemented psbt finalizer and extractor. Fixes #117 . 

This PR also has some small refactors.

- Decouples satisfaction API for reusing most code in psbt input and Tx input
- Completed psbt finalizer. Miniscript primarily relies on three types of constraints: timelocks, hashlocks and sigs. 
1. `Timelocks`: There is no special witness required from `psbt`. The transaction input contains `sequence` and transaction has the corresponding `locktime`.
2. `Hashlocks`: Awaiting on https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/955 and to be merged, psbt support in rust-bitcoin.
3. `Sigs`: Partial sigs contain the data required for the finalizer.

- Once the finalizer fills in the required fields, we double-check everything by running the interpreter and checking that there are no errors.
- Similarly, before extracting we double-check everything with the interpreter. 

The interpreter signature checks rely on sighash calculation from #116. Once the sighash functionality is added this PR can be updated to use it. Currently, this returns true. We can even merge this first and add the check in a followup PR once #116 is in.

events.message: BIP174: add hash preimage fields to inputs

issue.title: Add new hash preimage PSBTInput types

events.body: All the per-input fields have `_IN_` in their names, but these new fields do not. Why ?

I regret not having a watch turned on the bip repo, so I'm late with my comments, this is already merged.

But IMO it would be better to have one new field, `PSBT_IN_UNLOCKDATA`, and a byte that specifies the type of unlock, `PSBT_UNLOCKDATA_PREIMAGE_SHA256`, etc. Or `PSBT_IN_HASH_PREIMAGE` and four types of hashes.

As I understand, there's no reason to have several preimages of different type for a single input. Thus having them in different fields creates ambiguity. Should having both `SHA256` and `RIPEMD160` preimages be treated as error ?

@dgpv you can certainly have different kinds of preimages in one input (or multiple of a single kind of preimage)

As for the names missing `_IN_`, I think we should fix this. Good catch. I will open another PR.

issue.title: BIP174: add `_IN_` to names of new hash preimage fields
issue.body: As observed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/955 input fields should have `_IN_` in their names.

issue.title: Need to add support for new per-input PSBT fields for hash preimages
Added hash Preimages to psbt
issue.body:
Added hash preimages to psbt as per modified BIP 174. See https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/955. This will allow rust-miniscript a complete finalizer that can finalize hash preimages. (https://github.com/rust-bitcoin/rust-miniscript/pull/119) . 

Since the current version of the BIP does not have any tests for these, ~~I plan to add some roundtrip tests for the changes~~. 

Edit: Added tests

labels.name: minor API Change
labels.description: This PR should get a minor version bump

issue.title: Update PSBT v0 support
issue.body:
* Add support for preimage challenges (https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/955)
* Fix transaction serialization
* Add latest BIP test vectors
* Add P2WPKH support
* Add test cases
* Override toString on bitcoin amounts

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -200,6 +200,30 @@ The currently defined per-input types are defined as follows:
 ** Value: The UTF-8 encoded commitment message string for the proof-of-reserves.  See [[bip-0127.mediawiki|BIP 127]] for more information.
 *** <tt>{porCommitment}</tt>
 
+* Type: RIPEMD160 preimage <tt>PSBT_RIPEMD160 = 0x0a</tt>
+** Key: The hash which the preimage must hash to
+*** <tt>{0x0a}|{20-byte hash}</tt>
+** Value: The hash preimage, encoded as a byte vector, which must equal the key when run through the `RIPEMD160` algorithm
+*** <tt>{porCommitment}</tt>
comments.body: Should be `preimage`. same in the others.

@@ -198,7 +198,31 @@ The currently defined per-input types are defined as follows:
 ** Key: None. The key must only contain the 1 byte type.
 *** <tt>{0x09}</tt>
 ** Value: The UTF-8 encoded commitment message string for the proof-of-reserves.  See [[bip-0127.mediawiki|BIP 127]] for more information.
-*** <tt>{porCommitment}</tt>
+*** <tt>{preimage}</tt>
+
+* Type: RIPEMD160 preimage <tt>PSBT_RIPEMD160 = 0x0a</tt>
+** Key: The hash which the preimage must hash to
+*** <tt>{0x0a}|{20-byte hash}</tt>
+** Value: The hash preimage, encoded as a byte vector, which must equal the key when run through the `RIPEMD160` algorithm
+*** <tt>{preimage}</tt>
+
+* Type: SHA256 preimage <tt>PSBT_SHA256 = 0x0b</tt>
+** Key: The hash which the preimage must hash to
+*** <tt>{0x0b}|{32-byte hash}</tt>
+** Value: The hash preimage, encoded as a byte vector, which must equal the key when run through the `SHA256` algorithm
+*** <tt>{preimage}</tt>
+
+* Type: HASH160 preimage <tt>PSBT_HASH160 = 0x0c</tt>
+** Key: The hash which the preimage must hash to
+*** <tt>{0x0c}|{20-byte hash}</tt>
+** Value: The hash preimage, encoded as a byte vector, which must equal the key when run through the `SHA256` algorithm followed by the RIPEMD160 algorithm
comments.body:
> followed by the RIPEMD160 algorithm

 followed by the `RIPEMD160` algorithm

need the `s
